explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_solids.rationale: No data available by regulated examination methods, though "Flammable" (ICSC (J) (1999))

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and chlorine (but not fluorine) and these elements are chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although there is information that it corrodes irons and aluminum slightly (HSDB (Access on Jan. 2006)), test methods suitable for a solids material are not established.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on rat LD50 values: 5000 - 6000 mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001), 5000 - 7000 mg/kg (IARC 20, 1979), and 3460 - 7000 mg/kg (ATSDR, 2002). Since the calculated value was 4325mg/kg, it was set as Category 5.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: They were set as the outside of Category based on rat and rabbit LD50 values: all 6000mg/kg (PD, 2006).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin: We classified it as Out Of Category based on the description that it has almost or completely no skin sensitizing property in ACGIH (7th, 2001).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There was a negative result with the chromosome aberration test on mice sperm cells, which is an in vivo mutagenicity test using germ cells, and chromosome aberration test on mice marrow cells, which is an in vivo mutagenicity test using somatic cells (ATSDR, 2002). So it was classified as out of Category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It is classified into group 3 (IARC Suppl.7, 1987) in IARC, A4 (ACGIH 7th, 2001) in ACGIH and D (IRIS, 2006) in EPA in 1990. So it was considered as the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 based on the description that reduction of fertility was observed at the dose occuring general toxicity to parental animals in the rat oral administration reproductive study (ACGIH (7th, 2001), IRIS (2006), and ATSDR (2002)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was set as Category 2 (nerve systems) from description that the influence of the nervous systems, such as tremors, convulsions, paralysis, etc. was acknowledged in the doses of the guidance value range of Category 2 in the oral study using the rat of ATSDR (2002).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (liver, nervous system, endocrine system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that in the feeding oral administration tests using the rat, edema, necrosis and congestion of the liver were observed with the dosage in the Category 2 guidance value range (IRIS (2006)), the description that in feeding oral administration tests using the dog, the effects on the nervous systems, such as tremors and spasms, etc., were observed with the dosage in the Category 2 guidance value range (IARC 20 (1979)), and the dedscription that in the oral study using the rat or mouse, effects on the endocrine systems, such as increases in the prolactin level in pituitary, increased levels of hypothalamic GnRH (gonadotropin releasing hormones), and females menstrual cycle abnormalities, were observed with the dosage in the Category 2 guidance value range (IRIS (2006), NTP DB (2006), ATSDR (2002)), it was classified into Category 2 (liver, nervous systems, endocrine systems).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour LC50=0.78microg/L of Crustacea (Water flea) (HSDB, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and bioaccumulative (log Kow=5.08 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
